it.polito.dp2.NFFG.lab3

Interface NFFGClient


  • public interface NFFGClient
    An interface for interacting with a client of a service that provides the possibility to - upload NFFGs and reachability policies - remove previously uploaded reachability policies - verify previously uploaded reachability policies A number of NFFGs and policies are locally known by the client. They can be referenced by name and uploaded to the service. New policies can be uploaded to the service even if not locally known.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Loads all the known NFFGs and policies to the remote service (including verification results of policies when available).

      void unloadReachabilityPolicy(java.lang.String name)
      Unloads the reachability policy with a given name from the remote service

    • Method Detail

      • loadNFFG

        void loadNFFG(java.lang.String name)
       throws UnknownNameException,
              AlreadyLoadedException,
              ServiceException
        Loads the known NFFG with the given name into the remote service. This operation can fail if an NFFG with the same name already exists in the remote service.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the NFFG to be loaded
        Throws:
        UnknownNameException - if the name passed as argument does not correspond to a locally known NFFG. No alteration of data in the remote service occurs in this case.
        AlreadyLoadedException - if an NFFG with the same name already exists in the remote service.
        ServiceException - if any other error occurs when trying to upload the NFFG.

      • loadAll

        void loadAll()
      throws AlreadyLoadedException,
             ServiceException
        Loads all the known NFFGs and policies to the remote service (including verification results of policies when available). This operation can fail if an NFFG with the same name as one of the known NFFGs already exists in the remote service. If a policy with the same name as one of the known ones already exists in the remote service, the existing policy has to be overwritten.
        Throws:
        AlreadyLoadedException - if an NFFG with the same name already exists in the remote service.
        ServiceException - if any other error occurs when trying to upload the NFFG.

      • loadReachabilityPolicy

        void loadReachabilityPolicy(java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String nffgName,
                            boolean isPositive,
                            java.lang.String srcNodeName,
                            java.lang.String dstNodeName)
                     throws UnknownNameException,
                            ServiceException
        Loads a new reachability policy into the remote service given the policy properties. If a policy with the given name already exists in the service, the new policy substitutes the old one. The new policy is uploaded without a verification result.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to be given to the new policy
        nffgName - the name of a known NFFG the new policy refers to
        isPositive - true if the new policy is positive
        srcNodeName - the name of the source node of the new policy
        dstNodeName - the name of the destination node of the new policy
        Throws:
        UnknownNameException - if nffgName is not the name of a known NFFG, or srcNodeName and dstNodeName are not both nodes belonging to the known NFFG named nffgName.
        ServiceException - if any other error occurs when trying to upload the NFFG.

      • unloadReachabilityPolicy

        void unloadReachabilityPolicy(java.lang.String name)
                       throws UnknownNameException,
                              ServiceException
        Unloads the reachability policy with a given name from the remote service
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the reachability policy to be unloaded
        Throws:
        UnknownNameException - if the policy name passed as argument does not correspond to a reachability policy already loaded in the remote service
        ServiceException - if any other error occurs when trying to unload the policy

      • testReachabilityPolicy

        boolean testReachabilityPolicy(java.lang.String name)
                        throws UnknownNameException,
                               ServiceException
        Asks the service to test one of the previously uploaded reachability policies
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the reachability policy to be tested
        Returns:
        the result of the verification of the policy
        Throws:
        UnknownNameException - if the policy name passed as argument does not correspond to a reachability policy already loaded in the remote service
        ServiceException - if any other error occurs when trying to test reachability
